question: When you see a new motorcycle, what excites you the most?

options.a: Its sleek body design and structure
options.b: How fast and stable it moves
options.c: The electronics and systems inside

question: If given a project, which part would you enjoy more?

options.a: Sketching and modeling the design on software
options.b: Testing how strong and reliable the materials are
options.c: Automating the system to work on its own

question: Which activity sounds the most fun?

options.a: Building a small robot that moves on commands
options.b: Analyzing how air flows over a car model
options.c: Figuring out how circuits power gadgets

question: If you had to choose, what would you rather create?

options.a: A cool 3D design of a futuristic product
options.b: An efficient process to produce goods faster
options.c: A battery system that lasts longer

question: What kind of problems do you like solving?

options.a: Why a machine part isn’t moving correctly
options.b: Why an electronic circuit stopped working
options.c: Why the production line is slow

question: Imagine working on a team project. Which role attracts you?

options.a: The designer who creates the look and structure
options.b: The tester who checks if everything works safely
options.c: The coder who programs the system

question: Which school activity do you find more interesting?

options.a: Drawing and sketching in detail
options.b: Doing science experiments in the lab
options.c: Playing with circuits and wires in electronics class

question: If you had extra time, what would you explore?

options.a: Designing your own car or bike model
options.b: Creating a smart device that connects to your phone
options.c: Studying how materials bend, break, or resist stress

question: What would you prefer to work with?

options.a: Machines and gears
options.b: Sensors and instruments
options.c: Software and coding

question: Which invention do you admire the most?

options.a: Airplanes and cars
options.b: Smartphones and gadgets
options.c: Factories that can produce thousands of products every day

question: Which of these sounds most exciting to you?

options.a: Solving tricky puzzles or logic problems
options.b: Building apps or useful computer tools
options.c: Understanding how data is stored and accessed

question: Which project would you rather take on?

options.a: Designing a computer network for a school
options.b: Analyzing data to find interesting trends
options.c: Writing a program to sort millions of records quickly

question: What kind of challenge do you enjoy the most?

options.a: Understanding patterns in data and graphs
options.b: Improving the speed of a program
options.c: Creating websites or software people can use

question: If you're given a computer, what would you do first?

options.a: Check out how the network and internet are working
options.b: Install tools to work with data and spreadsheets
options.c: Try writing some code or script

question: Which topic sounds the most interesting to you?

options.a: How information is sent through the internet
options.b: How computers make decisions based on data
options.c: How to manage and organize huge amounts of data

question: If you had to teach something, what would it be?

options.a: Ways to solve math problems using logic
options.b: How to build and use a database
options.c: How to create useful software or tools

question: What do you like most in tech?

options.a: Finding smart solutions using code
options.b: Understanding how networks and systems connect
options.c: Analyzing data to make better decisions

question: What kind of school project would you enjoy the most?

options.a: Creating a small software or app
options.b: Collecting and interpreting data from a survey
options.c: Mapping out how computers share information

question: Which skill would you like to develop?

options.a: Building smarter algorithms for computers
options.b: Working with data to find patterns and insights
options.c: Managing information across systems and databases

question: Which area would you be curious to explore more?

options.a: How websites store and fetch your data
options.b: How to analyze and visualize data trends
options.c: How computers make predictions or decisions

question: Which activity would you enjoy the most?

options.a: Learning how the human body works
options.b: Studying plants and how they grow
options.c: Exploring bacteria and tiny life forms

question: If you could visit a lab, what would you want to see?

options.a: Cells and DNA under a microscope
options.b: How medicine is used to care for people
options.c: Experiments with soil and plants

question: Which topic sounds most interesting to you?

options.a: How the heart and lungs work
options.b: How plants make their own food
options.c: How tiny organisms cause disease

question: What kind of career sounds exciting?

options.a: Taking care of animals or learning how they live
options.b: Working in a lab to create new medicines or crops
options.c: Helping people stay healthy and recover from illness

question: If you had to do a science project, what would you choose?

options.a: Studying how different plants grow in various soils
options.b: Understanding how diseases spread between people
options.c: Examining how organs work in the human body

question: Which of these would you want to read more about?

options.a: New discoveries in DNA and genes
options.b: How to grow food more efficiently
options.c: How nurses take care of patients

question: Which area would you like to explore?

options.a: How plants and animals are different
options.b: How bacteria help or harm us
options.c: How the body heals from injuries

question: What kind of experiment sounds fun to you?

options.a: Testing how fertilizers affect plant growth
options.b: Observing how cells react to medicine
options.c: Practicing how to check a patient’s pulse

question: Which science class would you look forward to?

options.a: Learning about plant life and agriculture
options.b: Studying the structure of the human body
options.c: Discovering how viruses and bacteria work

question: Which of these real-world problems would you want to help solve?

options.a: Creating better crops to feed the world
options.b: Finding cures for diseases
options.c: Improving care for patients in hospitals
